website_summaries.verdict: A powerful, high-capacity machine that effortlessly accomplishes almost any mixing job. A must-have for serious cooks and those who want the best stand mixer available.
pros: A powerful kitchen tool with professional features
Boasts a 6-quart bowl, variety of mixing attachments,  and bowl lift for exceptional results
cons: It falls on the high end of the price spectrum, but you're paying for top-notch quality

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished sold as new
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the KitchenAid Professional 600 series to up my mixing game. I was a little concerned about the excessive grease on all the moving parts and a small scratch, but whatever. I cleaned it up and it was good to go. Then I register it with KitchenAid and find out that it’s been refurbished. Now it makes more sense. I go back and check, and sure enough, nowhere in the description does it say anything about being refurbished. When I pay $400 for a mixer, I expect a NEW $400 mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Antwon

customer_reviews.title: This mixer feels like it was made much more cheaply than the 4-5 ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought a 2nd tilt head mixer. This mixer feels like it was made much more cheaply than the 4-5 qt tilt head mixer. I do not like how loud it is and it sounds like it is laboring when mixing small batches. It is Not a good mixer in comparison to the 1st mixer I have from kitchen aid, (the tilt head) . I wish I would have sent it back right away. I would buy a second tilt head before I buy another mixer like this. For the money and the extra capacity, I do not think it's worth it. Save your money! Bigger is not always better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful !
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! I read lots of reviews before buying the Kitchen Aid 6 quart mixer. I heard Complaints about how loud the motor was and that it was difficult to attach the bowl and attachments. Wow! Were they wrong !This is the eaisest mixer to use! I Love It! And the noise is actually quieter than my old hand mixer. I would definitely would say Buy One! I Love it! The bowl is big enough to makes 3+ batches of Chocolate chip cookies dough. LOVE LOVE LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: S Walls

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present and I love the mixer. However, the dough hook and the paddle are NOT dishwasher safe. If you put them in the dishwasher, they will get a weird coating on them and then turn your food gray. They must be handwashed. That said, there is a website that explains how to boil them in vinegar to remove the gray "stuff" and bring it back to normal. Phew! I love the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Fezzik2

customer_reviews.title: Beware! It might not be what it seems
customer_reviews.text: It dripped oil and the motor strained at 10 cups of flour in a not very stiff bread dough. Some of the other colors on the site were labled refurbished models. I believe this was also refurbished, but sold as new, because for a new model at any other store the price is over $100 more than what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: SVF

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Didn’t live up to my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Prettt disappointed with this purchase. The mixer itself is fantastic, and the speeds are so much better. I can incorporate flour and powdered sugar at a much slower rate so that it’s doesnt fly out of my bowl. But I’m really upset with the attachments. The dough hook and paddle attachment came black with soot already coming off of them as if they were used improperly before sending to me. Also I can’t seem to get my attachments close enough to the edge of the bowl. There’s a least a quarter inch gap in between the whisk attachment and bowl. Just overall disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mason mingus

customer_reviews.title: worst ever product.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product five to six times to make the dough for Christmas, few days ago I tried to use it make a cake mixture, the engine made a noise, I looked inside the gear assembly, I found the gears are destroyed and everything is messed up. I just trashed the machine. I contacted the seller to buy a replacement for the gear assembly, he did not even reply.
customer_reviews.author: Laith Rofail

customer_reviews.title: but this one is breaking my baker's ears and sounds like it is about to die
customer_reviews.text: Lesson Learned . Purchased end of December 2017 . At initial use Mixer was extremely loud. Now Mixer is lourder and now operates very sluggish in low speed. Submitted a review as well as tried contacting Amazon. When we received review request, we noticed that refurbished was in the description but the order shows new. Trying to return and exchange and Amazon is sending me to Technical Support/ Customer Service to Kitchen Aid, Kitchen Aid rep states that nothing they can do but claim warranty through Amazon. Amazon shows return window was closed Jan 31, 2018 and only provides link back to Kitchen Aid. The old dreaded black hole
customer_reviews.author: Robert Critselous

customer_reviews.title: Died after seven years
customer_reviews.text: Grew up with a KitchenAid my mother had for 20 years, and still uses today. Got this one and thought it would last me for 20. We have five kids who love baking, and so we use this roughly every other day. We thought that we could make our standard four loaf bread dough recipe like we always did with our Bosch, but the motor couldn't handle it. Instead, we used it for cookies, pancake batter, and cakes. We loved it while it worked, but are amazed to log back onto Amazon to check our purchase date and see that it only last 7.5 years overall. Not sure what to buy to replace it now.
customer_reviews.author: Yoda

customer_reviews.title: is this really a kitchen aid?
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't handle dough well, like my older professional model (1997). I bought this because it was cheaper than getting my older one repaired; however, this machine gets bogged down and overheated so you have to unplug it, and you simply cannot use it for bread dough. More disappointingly, it came with attachments that do not have an enameled or plastic coating so the attachments get covered in a metal oxide layer that rubs off as a gray dust on your hands and on the food. When I contacted the seller, they offered to replace one of the attachments but not the rest. Who would use an attachment that visibly turns a dough gray from the oxide rub off???
customer_reviews.author: hwl

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: My K5 KitchenAid mixer that I purchased after I graduated from college 38 years ago died. I could have spent the money for replacement parts and fixed it, however since my original purchase, the machine itself has greatly improved. Took it for a ride as soon as I got it and made some homemade bread for my family; tomato basil bread and honey wheat bread. I am looking forward to another 38 years. Thank you KitchenAid. Thank you Amazon for the fast and safe shipping. It arrived in perfect condition. Jack
customer_reviews.author: Johannes

customer_reviews.title: Serious decline in product quality
customer_reviews.text: We own two of these, one bought many years ago with the mixing paddle covered in white enamel, and the other purchased very recently, with a bare metal paddle that, the first time used, after being washed, destroyed a cake mix with some grayish, oil-like stain. After scrubbing it endlessly, we were able to mix a second batch without this contamination. Tonight, my wife tried to make a birthday cake and gave up because the paddle stained her hands and we didn't have the energy to scrub it again. KitchenAid, by cutting corners, has made a once fine product a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: RAR

customer_reviews.title: Residu coming off sides of bowl and attachments
customer_reviews.text: Residu is coming off the sides of bowl and/mixing attachments. This never occurred with my previous Kitchenaide mixer. Too late to return... don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Lunsford

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have been a KitchenAid consumer for 30 years. I was so excited to upgrade to a bigger Kitchenaid mixer. However, after 2 months the mixer started not wanting to work on the low stir speed and it started making a clicking noise. After using it to make a batch of cookies, the mixer was hot and started making a whining noise. It took a long time for the mixer to cool off. At this time, I am working with amazon to return it. I am disappointed with this KitchenAid product.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B and/or Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: A  baker’s true kitchen essential
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace a 30 year old Kitchen-aid Pro series mixer. My wife is an avid and very accomplished baker. She is working the mixer on special baking project at least once a month. During the holidays the mixer is essential to baking over 10 variety of cookies as well as cakes and pies. After 30 years it was time to replace our Kitchen-aid Pro mixer. Selecting what to purchase was easy the gnawing question was is the quality still there. The new mixer was put to use just before the peak holiday baking season.....the quality is there as is the power.
customer_reviews.author: Errol R.

customer_reviews.title: My wife's new best friend
customer_reviews.text: my wife has have the 4 quart version for almost 20 years, so i got her the ^ quart pro series for Christmas this year ans she is in love with it. It has become her new best friend, she loves everything about it. With the size of the bowl and it be able to lift it up and down she is able to do large batches at once. It was the most used gift i have ever gotten her.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Price

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know why people like this machine
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why people like this machine. I made peanut butter cookies that called for 3 cups of flour and it sounded like it was going to die on me. I had it on speed 3 and the batter barely mixed properly. If I still have to mix it by hand then what is the mixer for? Save your money people, use your hand mixer that cost $12.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Smoothing Running Any Taking In Tailoring Just A Dream
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Smooth running, however, can be loud during operation. My wife broke it in (first use) making pretzels, peanut butter cookies, and whipped cream...within 6 hours. Needless to say, she loves this thing and will make weight loss challenging to say the least. Some people may find the placing of the mixing bowl challenging as it must be clicked in to secure. It may momentarily feel as though it has been broken, however, it just has a solid click once in place. Has a crank to lower/raise bowl closer to agitating arm. Must lower to secure bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Telecom Herk

customer_reviews.title: Love it...
customer_reviews.text: I like to give plenty of time before I review items in case there are latent problems. I may have gone a little overboard with this one since I have had it for roughly five years. However, this stand mixer is probably my favorite kitchen tool. It's still running flawlessly after all this time and I put it through some work. I make big batches of pizza dough quite frequently and I have never had a problem. Not one bad thing to say about it....
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: A great mixer for the home.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned several KITCHENAID stand mixers over the years. They’ve been great. I bought this one because I had given my second machine to a friend who is a home chef. I keep one in the kitchens in both my homes. I’ve used them for bread making, sausage stuffing, vegetable shredding, etc... using all the accessories. I’ve never had a problem with these great American Made mixers. The only issue I’ve ever had was with the plastic grinder attachement which tends to crack at the base, so for this mixer I bought the heavy stainless steel attachment from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. De Young

customer_reviews.title: Great for my online bakery
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this big momma after my 4.5qt artisan KA started to let me know it was gonna go out soon. I run an online bakery & make several batches of cookie dough a day and week (3-4 batches a day, 3-4x a week). It’s greats. HOWEVER, You will have to purchase a 3rd party paddle attachment. The paddle attachment that comes with the mixer does not reach sides or bottom. It’s as if it’s for a 5qt bowl. Love my mixer & expect it to last 5years if not more just like my 4.5qt artisan one did.
customer_reviews.author: priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Can’t handle bread or pasta dough
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty far from “pro” grade. It can’t handle 2 pounds of bread dough w/o clicking and grinding to a halt. It can’t handle 24oz of pasta dough either. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MsDelilah

customer_reviews.title: Bowl it too tight in grip.
customer_reviews.text: I wished I had purchased the one in which the top lifts up. This model makes getting the bowl out VERY difficult. NOT liking the wasted time I spend pulling on the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: PEGGY

customer_reviews.title: Not your Grandmother's
customer_reviews.text: Like most products in our time, the quality isn't what it used to be. Spent many years using my grandmother's KitchenAid. Finally reached a point in my life to get my own as a new home owner. It's still a good product, but I don't see this one lasting 20+ years. Makes some odd noises, isn't as smooth. Implement to bowl clearance is still too much despite maxing out the adjustment. Left me disappointed, but if I didn't have an old KitchenAid to compare it to then I might feel differently. This ships in packaging that displays what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without my Kitchen Aid stand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product and I have never been disappointed with Kitchen Aid mixers. I have no idea of what “clicking” noises that other reviews are speaking about. I can tell you that if you do not have the bowl “clicked” in properly in the back it does mak a clicking noise. I forgot one time and wondered if that was what I read about. I use my mixer almost every day, including for double batches of bread dough. Amazon and Kitchen Aid has always stood by their products with me. I love all my Kitchen Aid stand mixers!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Ortolani

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product, the motor went out within a few weeks. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Micah Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the size. Very awkward to work with. Mainly mashed potatoes, does a decent job, but got to stick beater in bowl of potatoes, place on pins that hold bowl, attach beater, and reverse procedure to remove. Very hard to add ingredients to bowl, even with cheap plastic bowl cover. Also bought the 3 at bowl. Whipping egg whites is a joke if only doing 2-4 for a receipe. Better results using old hand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It showed up in 2 days with prime shipping and I couldn’t be happier. I have used it twice so far and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a KitchenAid for years but never pulled the trigger on getting one. I saw an ad on tv about a local department store having a huge sale. After looking all over the internet I found this one for half the price of the department store sale price! I knew it was meant to be. It showed up in 2 days with prime shipping and I couldn’t be happier. I have used it twice so far and it’s everything I would ask for. Can’t wait to add some attachments to the family.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent powerful mixer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my beloved Artisan Design 325 watt mixer as I needed more power. This is the most powerful and well designed mixer for my needs. Just home cooking and baking, but I reallyneed the power for cookie doughs I make. Wish they came with an additional half size mixing bowl, but will buy separately since this is the ONLY negative so far, does not mix small quantities well.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki of CA

customer_reviews.title: Happy birthday to me!
customer_reviews.text: This is the powerful mixer I’ve been wanting! It arrived in time to make my birthday 🎂 just like Mom used to make for me. It is so much more powerful than any I’ve had for years and I over beat my divinity frosting. 😄 it was taller than my other appliances and won’t fit under my cabinets. I should have measured!! But now I get to build a baking center in an empty corner of my kitchen, so the birthday gifts continue.
customer_reviews.author: Ray and Kathie

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: We've used this for only four months and the stainless steel bowl is already rusting on the inside. It is only hand washed, so while the blender works fine, I am not impressed with the durability of the components. We've had bowls from previous models over the last twenty five years that are still new looking, and they put this newer model to shame.
customer_reviews.author: CAPT

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and stronger
customer_reviews.text: I have had a very basic model of kitchen-aid mixer for many years. It certainly served me well, but I did experience frustration with the capacity and occasional lack of power. I admit to casting envious glances at the bigger and more colorful models. When I received some gift cards I made the leap and splurged. I have used it a few times and am already delighted with the increased capacity and power. There has been some adjustment to the lift bowl instead of the tilt head, but that will lessen in time.
customer_reviews.author: Moneypitt

customer_reviews.title: Issues Turning On
customer_reviews.text: This short review is for the KitchenAid KP26M1XTG 6Qt. Professional 600 stand mixer. This mixer has issues turning on. I had to turn it on and off multiple times before it started mixing. I'm returning it in favor of The KitchenAid 8Gt. commercial grade mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Farse ugas

customer_reviews.title: Came with coated, not burnished parts, nice.
customer_reviews.text: Just got one today so I cannot comment on durability, but the quality out of the box is very good. One thing I was worried about was if it would fit under my cabinets on the counter. No problem lots of space to spare. Actually stays shorter than my artisan because the head flipped up. One added bonus I did not expect was it came with silver coated bread hook and flat beater not burnished. Nice. I hope this holds up as well as my artisan has, perhaps even as long has my moms 30 year old KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Cardinal

customer_reviews.title: Will not run
customer_reviews.text: I took the mixer out of the box, connected the bowl, the beater, raised it - turned it on and nothing. It is dead. Called Kitchenaid. They sent me a new one - same problem, it is broken and will not run right out of the box. I feel like I just threw away the money. I will never again purchase one of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Whitaker Hill

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy strong and my wife loves the look
customer_reviews.text: From what I have seen of other people's smaller mixers, I wouldn't waste my money on the smaller ones. This type has a bigger motor and does not have the hinged top that gets weak and breaks on the smaller ones. This has taken a beating and still runs like new after years. My wife loves to use this. It did take her a bit of getting used to how to seat the bowl, but after she got used to that, it has been great in all respects.
customer_reviews.author: laBarista Is In

customer_reviews.title: Not for small amount
customer_reviews.text: High quality - I mainly use it for making dough - the problem that I have with is the minimum amount of dough. It doesn't work if you want to make a small amount of dough (e.g. for one or two pizzas)
customer_reviews.author: Azadeh

customer_reviews.title: Bought It For My Wife And She Cooks Now!!!!
customer_reviews.text: She actually loves to cook and I do all I can to nourish that so I bought her this. She's always wanted a mixer. She uses this to bake everything from bread to all kinds of sweets and even uses it to shred chicken when she makes things like Chicken Spaghetti. She loves it! I love it because I get to reap the benefits! If you're a man and you're married do yourself a favor and buy your wife a mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: If you get this mixer get an extended warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I love the mixer, just wish they had better gears inside of them. I bought this mixer in 2017 to replace one I bought in 2010. It lasted 2.5 years of weekly use. Usually bread and then some other light mixing. Both machines failed in their gears. First on housing cracked, this one it was the drive gear. Husband ordered replacement gears and I ordered another mixer and the 4 year extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie J Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Sooo gorgeous and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If you're a big baker or cook, I would strongly recommend this Professional 600 over the Artisan. So much more room and easier to clean. We got the Fresh Linen color and its' gorgeous! Even better than the picture! A kitchen staple for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Xandra W.

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife - Happy Life!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife - It’s built like the proverbial brickwork lavatory. It’s large, and heavy and gives the impression that my grandkids will likely be using it. The only complaint so far is that there isn’t a glass bowl available, but given the number of available accessories, I’d be surprised if that’s a permanent issue.
customer_reviews.author: MistaDan

customer_reviews.title: Not powerfull enough
customer_reviews.text: I love the kitchen aide mixers, however I keep finding them to be under powered when making my cookie recipes. I have had a 375 watt and now this one which is somewhere between 425 and 475 watts, I can't remember exactly. Both of these mixers slow way down and sound like they are struggling bad, then there is sometimes a smell. Now reason why not less stars is because even though they struggle, neither mixer died on me.
customer_reviews.author: ornery n AK

customer_reviews.title: This mixer is the best!!!
customer_reviews.text: KitchenAid has a great reputation and this mixer has not disappointed. We purchased in 2008 and it is still going strong. My daughter was 3 when we got it from Amazon and now she is 11 and she uses the mixer weekly. This mixer has been a beast, the only thing negative I would say is the whisk attachment doesn't seem to reach the bottom of the bowl well. I don't know if it holds up to commercial use but it definitely has been more than adequate in our home and has been used a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, well...I love what comes out of it, my girlfriend loves using it. lol. I emailed KitchenAid this model number (KP26M1XBU) because I wanted to make sure I got the right one, and they confirmed for me that it does indeed have the metal gears and metal transmission cover. Also, I was hoping to get the glass bowl, but after talking to a few people they actually said they prefer the metal bowl because once it's filled up, it's so much lighter to use. And since my girlfriend is 5ft-nothin 100lbs...it's probably easier on her too. haha.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Four generationsuse Kitchenaid stand mixer
customer_reviews.text: The Kitchenaid stand mixer has been an important fixture in the kitchens of four generations. It had created more cakes than we can count , multiple loaves of bread, ground meat, juiced oranges and done so may other things. So, from great grandmother to grandmother to mother to daughters the tradition continues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New? Refurb?
customer_reviews.text: I thought I purchased a BRAND NEW Kitchenaid; however, when it arrived, the wire wisk was in a gallon Ziplock brand baggie and there are marks on it as if it has been used before.
customer_reviews.author: Jim and Pam Scott

customer_reviews.title: im so disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this as new unit . 2 months ago . the return policy is 1 month ? laat week it started makng noises as i turn it on . i dont know whats going on . or how to fix it . im so disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: Finally got the mixer I always wanted at a great value
customer_reviews.text: I was a little intimidated to have to adjust the beater height to the bottom of the bowl, but it was easy. This makes prep SO much easier than any other mixer I've used. The height just barely fits under my cabinets so I put on a slim cutting mat to make it easy to slide out. I got some other attachments to go with, now I just need to get busy! Super bonus was the color I wanted was at the lowest price I'd seen even on the non-lift model!! Win win.
customer_reviews.author: GLK

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Design
customer_reviews.text: This product works well on everything you mix. The heavy duty construction works well on recipes with large batters. You won't have to worry about the motor dying because this product is designed to handle large loads. My son suggested this mixer for his recipes of bread, which contain thick and hard to mix batters.
customer_reviews.author: annieoakley

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Quality machine in design and overall fit and finish. Bread hook and wire whip work well but the flat beater tended to impact the side of the bowl at one point in the orbit. I had to remedy it by milling the beater at the impact point.
customer_reviews.author: LJohn

customer_reviews.title: Happy So Far!
customer_reviews.text: I will update my review as I use the machine this week. So far so good. This is a brand new machine and everything is included that was advertised. I have a small mixer for small batch items but need a larger mixer for my major batches. I expect this to be 5 stars, don’t disappoint me kitchenaid!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Bad if not making large quantities
customer_reviews.text: Can't mix regular sized quantities as the paddle doesn't come close enough to the edge of the bowl. Until you get half an inch on the bottom it only uniformly pushes the product against the edge and then doesn't mix it. I have to use a much cheaper stand mixer most of the time since the cheaper one does a better job unless I have a big job.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I’m so happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy with this!!! Just got it less than a week ago and used several times. I originally bought the artisan at a store and lived it but after a few weeks I realized I would be using this all the time and I wanted to up grade to the professional. So happy I did. It’s more powerful, bigger bowl, doesn’t shake as much. I have the shredder attachment, pasta rollers, pasta press, and spiralizer. They are all great. I will never eat boxed pasta again!
customer_reviews.author: Jet

customer_reviews.title: Much better for bread dough than the other KitchenAid mixers
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a cheaper KitchenAid mixer, thinking that it would be good for bread dough. It wasn't. Did a little bit of research, ponied up a little more money and this one works great. It doesn't have to really get the motor going like mad like the others might have to when you use it to mix for bread dough. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: My second mixer. This one was an upgrade. I love the larger size bowl and the double edge scraper beater. I can do double batches and the handle on this bowl is so convenient. Although some reviews complained about this machine being noisy, I have found it to be relatively low in noise which surprised me. An all around dream of a machine. If you can swing the extra cash, I advise this machine if you do lots of baking and all around use in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A mixer should mix ...
customer_reviews.text: I am giving a three cause the paddle -wisk and hook does not come close enough to the sides or bottom and i have to manually scrape sides n bottom when making cookies, cakes and butter. It matters on getting all the ingredients all mixed- sometime I might as well do it with the mixer-isnt that the point? A mixer is to MIX?
customer_reviews.author: kindle68

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, but... note the past tense.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thing while it lasted, my first-ever Kitchenaid mixer, and used it a lot. Until this morning, less than two years after purchase, when it stopped mid-knead and started spewing out smoke. Less than two years? Really?! I thought these had a reputation for reliability and durability! Not to mention that it died on Easter morning, when it was badly needed. Of course the warranty is only a year, so I'm just out of luck. For the price, I'll have to think long and hard before replacing it with another Kitchenaid. A motor that dies after 22 months is very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Schuneman

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS MACHINE!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted one of these for a LONG time. We use it at least once a month. It's perfect for the large batches of icing or homemade cake batters. Every home should have one of these if you love to bake or cook.
customer_reviews.author: Morticia89

customer_reviews.title: Ok but.......
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally wrote this for mixer cover. Mixer us ok but gray corating of attachments kept ruining my batters. Finally had to REALLY scrub them to get coating off. Still gets on my hands at times. Not happy about that
customer_reviews.author: princess

customer_reviews.title: I thought i was having trouble with the mixer because the accessory was bumping the bowl and i adjusted it like the instructions
customer_reviews.text: I have never been a baker, but since my husband gave me this mixer I have been baking cookies and cakes.I thought i was having trouble with the mixer because the accessory was bumping the bowl and i adjusted it like the instructions said to. However, i realized after a while i wasn't seating the bowl into the lock. Since, then it's been working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: This machine is beautiful! I love the color. My only draw back is that I live in an older home without 3 prong grounded outlets in my kitchen, I have to move this heavy thing from there to my dining room to use it because directions say not to use an adapter. I still gave it 5 stars because that's my problem, not kitchenaid!
customer_reviews.author: Awood

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a smaller older model. I had one of the smaller tilting head artisan models. I make bread and sausage and kept breaking the worm gear on the smaller model. It also acted like it was going to bounce off the counter. I would have to strap the head down to keep it from flying up. Since this has a really strong lever system that lifts the bowl to a stationary head and all metal gear construction it can handle larger jobs. I also like the larger capacity bowl. This thing is a beast.
customer_reviews.author: aukalou

customer_reviews.title: Sent a used/defective item
customer_reviews.text: I bought the blue one from Amazon and originally had the black one. The blue color is stunning but it seems like it has a lot less power than my black one when set at the same speed. I have attached a video to show you the difference in speed/power. Also the attachment piece was rusted on arrival (picture attached) not sure if they sent me a refurbished one. Pretty disappointed, I hope it doesn't break down on me.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Ho

customer_reviews.title: Not for bread making..
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a kitchen aid mixer. So I finally got myself one for Christmas. I immediately started in baking cookies, cakes, brownies, and eventually bread. That where it all went wrong... bread. When I try to make bread, during the kneading process the mixer gives off an electrical burning smell and has a very hard job completing the task. I end up having to take it out and knead it by hand, which is unfortunate and part of the reason I purchased the mixer. Overall I still like the mixer but can only use it for easy tasks and have decided making bread is really not possible with this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Haley G.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 13 months, just after the warranty ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 13 months, just after the warranty expired. While mixing 3 pounds of dough the mixer started "limping" on the right side, then blocked completely. Must say that it always had problems mixing dough over 2 pounds of weight. Really disappointing, would never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: 575 watt professional model lacks power.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this mixer to grind meat which it does just fine, but it will not knead bread dough longer than 5 minutes without overheating and stopping. I'm using the kitchenaid recipe to make two small bread loafs and have tired it 5 times, I have to finish kneading the dough by hand. I believe kitchenaid is a overrated product and I will not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: VANCE COBLE

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud
customer_reviews.text: Come on KitchenAid, make this mixer quieter. Dishwasher manufacturers have figured it out, get your engineers to work and quite this mixer down. Too heavy to return, looks like well have to put up with an '80's motor in a otherwise great mixer.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Arrison IV

customer_reviews.title: Way to ruin the surprise at xmas!
customer_reviews.text: Once again, good job with the packaging Amazon! Thanks for ruining the Christmas surprise... Would it kill you to put this box in a discreet package. I don’t know so when once again the wife comes home to find her Christmas present sitting on the step. UGH! Maybe I’ll give Wayfair a shot next xmas!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Kupiec

customer_reviews.title: I love the product
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, but I am so disappointed in Kitchen Aid. This is the same size as my previous Kitchen Aid. I had all the attachments for mixing along with an extra bowl. They changed the dimensions of the bowl so none of the other attachments work as expected and now I need to buy new. /seems like a little money grubbing on the part of the company.
customer_reviews.author: HSG

customer_reviews.title: I've used kitchenaid for at least 18 years. My ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used kitchenaid for at least 18 years. My last mixer lasted over 10 years. That's what I was expecting with this one. Boy was I wrong. It died after 14 months, which is of course two months after the manufactured guarantee. I can't say I'll buy another one. I would have given my last mixer 5 stars... this one gets 2 for the 14 months it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: I love it but.. kitchenaid make some good quality accessories please.
customer_reviews.text: It's a lovely addition to my kitchen, first day I made some bread, I usually use my bread maker but I have to say... this was easy and the bread end up perfect; I also made some whipped pudding to perfection. It's yes a little noisy, but nothing to die for, the only thing I don't like it's the quality of the accessories, not dishwasher safe is a bummer, please make some good quality ones that can match the quality of the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra O'C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality declined significantly over 30 years
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 6 quart, hoping for same smooth strong motor. First time on, a rattling sound, brand new. Does NOT work as well as my old 4.5 qt. Kitchenaid over last 35 years. Bought to replace old mixer, all gears do not work as strong. Was able to completely knead my bread dough with old. With new, can only run 5 minutes!!! Or I guess warranty does not cover. Motor is extremely poor compared to decades ago. Plastic shield is HALF as thick as old one. Cost has been cut but so has quality!! Am glad I purchased extra warranty, will probably need it. Disappointed. Will not buy another Kitchenaid, too poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: There are screws falling out
customer_reviews.text: When I open the box and take out the machine, there is a screw that falls out, and I can't find where I should lock it. I feel a little scared when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi

customer_reviews.title: After 6 weeks this mixer has died.
customer_reviews.text: Come to find out, I bought it in 2019, but the damn thing is from 2013. Thanks for selling me an old product, with old oil, that locked up shortly after purchase. Kitchen aid in good will, is sending me a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Tanji Lee Wendorff

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Wedding present for niece. These are the best around and she will have it for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel C. Itin

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer but...
customer_reviews.text: Love this mixer because of the bowl size. I don’t like the fact the bowl height is not as adjustable as the smaller mixers. Also the bowl can be hard to get in the right place so it stays in place. Does very well mixing heavy dough. Overall a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Che

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality mixer
customer_reviews.text: I recommend that you not purchase this mixer. Lots of pretty colors, but poor quality. We purchased this mixer in April 2018. It is now February 2020 and the motor already has problems - high pitched sound and a burning smell. Past the 1 year warranty so need to pay for a repair, if repair is even possible. We had out last Kitchen Aid mixer for over 20 years before the motor failed. KitchenAid no longer means quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Basic

customer_reviews.title: Versatile machine
customer_reviews.text: I had mixed feelings about this item. It's heavy and a bit awkward until one gets used to it and its many fine features. My Daughter in Law loves it. (it was a gift to her). She has become quite adept at mixing, shredding, grinding meat, making ice cream. She purchased several attachments.
customer_reviews.author: heepatrubl

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! Not at all what I expect from Kitchen Aid. I bought this as an “upgrade” from my 19 year old tilt-head model. This is crap. Cheaply made. Beater chipped with first use. Bowl doesn’t sit right. PIECE OF GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Not A great gift after all.
customer_reviews.text: A versatile kitchen workhorse that performs as promised. Wife is happy and smiling. She really liked the pink hue also. I recommend the up graded whisk. The standard one shipped with the mixer does not have as many tines and is kind of limited in usefulness. Update Aug 3 2019. Sad to say but this mixer is now just a bad boat anchor. Way to many issues with this mixer and now again it's back to a no start issue. I think this one was made by Yugo cars. Will be buying a older modle hobart A 210 something in that range. Will not be buying Kitchen Aid again.
customer_reviews.author: Bronwynn Huttger

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: My wife has always wanted one of these and I purchased this for her back at Christmas and the goodies have not stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Robb Perrenoud

customer_reviews.title: Love the machine, hate the attachments
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! I HATE the attachments that come with this model. They are very cheaply made and the finish on them is coming off. There is something about the "chrome" that keeps flicking off and discoloring when I wash it, I'm very disappointed. I wish this model came with the white attachments or if these attachments could be replaced?
customer_reviews.author: jweaving

customer_reviews.title: This thing beats the heck out of a hand mixer.
customer_reviews.text: This series stand mixer is the best and strongest you can get. It looks great in our kitchen. The week after we bought it, we went gluten free and thought that we had wasted the money on this, but then we found a ton of gluten free recipes and still use this when we whip up a big batch of muffins.
customer_reviews.author: Kampers

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Powerful Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for some time now, and I'm very happy with it. This was my first KitchenAid product. It took me many years to finally get one, but I chose this one after careful consideration. This model is larger than average, powerful, and lifts rather than tilts (a feature I love). I was used to hand mixers all my life, so having something that can run the job while I do other cooking or prep work is almost like having another person helping in the kitchen. The silver finish is elegant but not overpowering, goes with anything.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Mann

customer_reviews.title: This machine should have a head lift
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product ideal for making great cakes without all of the mess, however the head doesn't lift. This was a gift to me for Christmas. I was indeed ex tactic, but the head does not lift. What is up with that? There are many little important details that were missed when designing this one. I wish that the company would have used a real baker to decide what would make it better for use.
customer_reviews.author: Shonda Lynette Beverly

customer_reviews.title: If I could I'd Marry it!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutly Love this mixer, It's my second & prob Last Kitchen Aid Mixer, (I Lost my 1st one in a house fire), It's Beautiful, it just goes & goes, I can make my homemade Pizza dough in minutes without getting messy, Whip my potatoes, mix my cookies , Cake mixes, anything I want. Easy clean up, just rinse right after use, I'm totally in L-O-V-E with it!!!
customer_reviews.author: PEGGY BERG

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gift for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: I promised my daughter I would buy her a Kitchen aid stand mixer of her own. This a personal gift I promised her. She loves to cook and especially bake. Now she is engaged and I couldn't think of a more perfect gift. I know there will be plenty of good food made with this wonderful mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Bluestreak

customer_reviews.title: Good Company
customer_reviews.text: Kitchenaid makes high quality mixers so we were surprised to discover that the mixer made loud clicking sounds when we turned it on. We called Kitchenaid and they readily sent us a new mixer and we returned the old one at their expense. The new mixer works fine!
customer_reviews.author: C. Keedy

customer_reviews.title: It's a KitchenAid:)
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of machine and it was purchased for my 78 year old mom who made the mistake of trading her smaller KitchenAid for a lighter machine of a different brand to her granddaughter. Of coarse she quickly noticed (her mistake) difference in performance and quality and wanted a new one with a larger bowl. This one is perfect for mom in every way. She loves the lift bowl feature and the large capacity bowl and stronger motor. Mom is very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Maria

customer_reviews.title: go for color!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. We bought this same one six years ago as refurbished and a gear just cracked and broke in it last week. Too expensive to fix. This new one is great and is much quieter. Plus, we have a beautiful cobalt one now. We have a red coffee pot, a turqouise toaster, a lime green food processor, why not a cobalt blue mixer. Be bold embrace color. Since we had this model before, we now have two sets of everything, which is good. I also recommend getting the kitchenaid beater with the scraper blade, its a must! If you are a baker, this is the model you want.
customer_reviews.author: melz

customer_reviews.title: It’s beautiful and works fantastic for a big batch of cookies,
customer_reviews.text: I love my KitchenAid,,,the color is awesome and I absolutely love using it, it does take up a lot of room on the counter. So I have to put it away after I use it. So the only thing that is sort of a negative. Is that it sure is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie E. Hiatt-Bridges

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE IT!! I'm just replacing my 23 year old Kitchen Aid mixer (handed down to my daughter) for more power and a larger mixing bowl. Just like any Kitchen Aid, this is very sturdy, and all parts are metal, including the beaters. This will be the last mixer I ever purchase.
customer_reviews.author: VRRMMM

customer_reviews.title: kitchenaid KP26M1xdp professional6 quartstand mixer
customer_reviews.text: very nicely made,it it so much heavy,its built like a tank
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey ankiel

customer_reviews.title: Beauty and a Beast
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, super powerful mixer. Built like you remember Kitchen Aid from way back. Big bowl- much larger than the Classic and even the stepped up models. Tons of beautiful colors available, too. Had a Classic for 15 or more years and loved it, but found that it was a little underpowered when my wife made double batches of cookies and bread dough. This beast handles those jobs with no problem and looks great doing it! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color and quite useful!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at this for a year and finally caved to the temptation. Love the color! And, more importantly, it works great. I have used it to make banana bread, chocolate chip bread, soft pretzels, baguettes, Tuscan bread, cinnamon rolls, icing, dinner rolls and pound cake. I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: I had to really clean the bowl when I first ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to really clean the bowl when I first started because my Buttercream turned gray. It is a little loud. Honestly I am not that impressed with it. I have a smaller kitchenaid that is 20 years old, The older one has more power then this. It took me a while to finally purchase it after looking at all reviews. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Bohlken

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and durable product. It really helps with making bread or mixing dough. Little expensive but so far, worth the money. I have not had it long enough to see how it does overtime.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pelissier

customer_reviews.title: Defects right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The bowl had a scratch on the outside right out of the box, and there were black grease prints and smudges all on the machine... But I just wiped it down and carried on. Then after only using once I noticed that the paint was chipping off on the corners and oily/grease was dripping down the base. I was so excited to buy this. But with the price I am disappointed that that its already having defects.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Stone

customer_reviews.title: Pain to scrape the bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Pro Mixer, the larger size bowl allows for me to make larger batches at one time which I love! My only complaint is that I don't like that you have to practically take the beater off to scrape the bowl and I really miss being able to lift the head of the smaller mixer. I thought just dropping the bowl down would be great but it really isn't as good as being able to lift the head up and out of the bowl to scrape and mix.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Walker

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I had the smaller one for years but when I began making bread again I wanted the stronger motor. It is awesome. My only problem with it is that it is very heavy. My kitchen is small so I can't leave it on the counter. I can deal with that for the extra oomph it provides!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KP26M1XER 6 Qt. Professional 600 Series Bowl-Lift Stand Mixer - Empire Red
product_meta.description: Color:Empire RedThe Professional 600 Series 6-Quart Bowl-Lift Stand Mixer is perfect for heavy, dense mixtures. Burnished metal flat beater, PowerKnead Spiral dough hook and 6-wire whisk will help you mix, knead and whip ingredients into culinary masterpieces quickly and easily. And for even more versatility, the power hub fits optional attachments from food grinders to pasta makers and more. Wipe Stand Mixer with a soft, damp cloth.Do not use household/commercial cleaner
feature_bullets: 6-quart stainless steel bowl with comfortable handle
10 different speeds, powerful enough for any task or recipe
Includes: burnished flat beater, power knead spiral dough hook, wire whip.Electrical:60 Hz

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,266 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
